description: Numbers formed from binomial coefficients (mod 2) interpreted as digits in factorial base.
links: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..448
example: a(5) = 1!+2!+5!+6! = 843 (Only the first, second, fifth and sixth terms are odd at the row 5 of Pascal's Triangle).
maple: A051256(n) := proc(n) local i; RETURN(add(((binomial(n,i) mod 2)*((i+1)!)),i=0..n)); end;
prog: (Python)from math import factorialdef A051256(n):    return sum(0 if ~n & k else factorial(k+1) for k in range(n+1)) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Feb 08 2016
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 24 1999
